title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Fundamentals of Ecology: Producers, consumers and decomposers; Food chain and trophic levels; Energy flows in ecosystems; estimates of primary production; Populations, communities and ecosystems; Species interactions; Population growth and dynamics; Biomes: terrestrial and aquatic ecosystems Fundamentals of Environmental Microbiology: Introduction: overview of microbiology and cell biology; Classification of organisms and cells, microscopy; Cell chemistry and structures; Nutrition, metabolism and biosynthesis; Growth and its control; Energetics and stoichiometry of growth; Metabolic diversity among microorganisms; Biogeochemical cycles; Microbe-human interactions; Major microbial diseases - airborne, waterborne, food-borne.
